name: python_starter
title: Python Starter
description: Get started with Python on your computer, learn how to install Python and create a simple programme

steps.title: Download and Install Python
steps.description: Download and install Python onto your computer

components.text: Open your prefered internet browser and go to https://www.python.org/downloads/
**Click** download Python 3
Confirm the download, if asked save the download on your Desktop
**Open the downloaded file** when the download finishes

lines: **Double click on the file to open it**
If any warning message appears about opening the file select `Run` or `Continue`

components.text: On a Windows computer **Tick Add Python 3.5 to PATH** then click 'Install Now'
On a Mac computer click 'Continue'
Follow the on screen instructions to install Python on your computer
Search your computer for 'IDLE'

lines: On Windows **Press Windows + S** and type 'idle'
On Mac **Press cmd + space** and type 'idle'

components.text: Open IDLE and a 'Python Shell' window should appear
Did IDLE successfully open on your computer?

steps.title: Creating Python files
steps.description: Python script can be written in a file so you can write more code and save your work

components.text: Make sure you have opened IDLE and you can see a 'Python Shell' window
Click `File -> New File` to create a new Python file
Type the following code into the new file
To run the file click `Run -> Run Module`
When you run a file it will ask if you want to save, **Click OK** to save the file

lines: **To stop Python asking you each time you save**

components.text: Save your Python file on the Desktop and call it `my_first_script.py`

hidden.text: When saving Python files only use **letters, numbers and underscrores** as the computer find spaces difficult

components.text: Did your script sucessfully run and print out 'Hello Your Name Here'?
Now we can get the computer to ask what your name is, edit your code to look like the following
components.code:
myName = input('What is your name?')
print('Hello',myName)

components.text: Now run your code, on Windows **Press F5** on a Mac **Press fn + F5**
When your script runs **type your name** into the Python Shell then **press enter**
Does your script now greet you by the name you provide?

steps.title: Using the Command Line
steps.description: Python can be run from the command line which is how its mostly used by developers

components.text: Open up the command line (click the question mark to see how)

lines: On Windows **Press Windows + S** and type 'cmd'
On Mac **Press cmd + space** and type 'terminal'

components.text: With the command line open type 'python3' on a mac or 'python' on windows
Did the Python interpreter start? It should look something like bellow
components.code:
Python 3.5.1 (v3.5.1:37a07cee5969, Dec  5 2015, 21:12:44)
[GCC 4.2.1 (Apple Inc. build 5666) (dot 3)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

components.text: Check that 'my_first_script.py' is on the Desktop using the following commands
Is 'my_first_script.py' on the Desktop? If not save the file again using IDLE
Run your Python file by typing this code into the command line
components.code:
mac$ python3 my_first_script.py
windows> python my_first_script.py

components.text: Does your script run and greet you by the name you provide?

steps.title: Install Sublime Text
steps.description: Sublime Text is an advanced text editor used to write computer code

components.text: Open your preferred Internet browser and go to http://www.sublimetext.com/3
Download either the Windows or Mac installer
Confirm the download, if asked save the download on your Desktop
**Open the downloaded file** when the download finishes

lines: **Double click on the file to open it**
If any warning message appears about opening the file select `Run` or `Continue`

components.text: On a Mac computer drag the Sublime icon into your application folder
Follow the on screen instructions to install Sublime on your computer
Search your computer for 'Sublime Text'

lines: On Windows **Press Windows + S** and type 'sublime'
On Mac **Press cmd + space** and type 'sublime'

components.text: Open Sublime Text and a 'Sublime Text' window should appear
Did Sublime Text successfully open on your computer?
